Class StringUtils

java.lang.Object
  gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.StringUtils

public class StringUtils
extends Object

Utilities for string operations.

showArguments

public static String showArguments(Object... args)
Creates a string with all arguments separated by comma.

Parameters:
args - arguments to present.
Returns:
Returns a string consisting by all arguments separated by a comma.

leftJustify

public static String leftJustify(String str,
                                 int len,
                                 char c)
Creates a left justified string of specified length. Example leftJustify("test",10,'a'); "test" --> "testaaaaaa" |----10----| If the input string is lengthier than the len argument then the result string is not truncated, but rather is the same as the input string.

Parameters:
str - input String
len - length of output String
c - character that fills blanks
Returns:
a String of length len that has the input String str in the left part. If length of str is less than len, then the remaining characters on the riht are filled with character c

rightJustify

public static String rightJustify(String str,
                                  int len,
                                  char c)
Creates a right justified string of specified length. Example rightJustify("test",10,'a'); "test" --> "aaaaaatest" |----10----|

Parameters:
str - input String
len - length of output String
c - character that fills blanks
Returns:
a String of length len that has the input String str in the right part. If length of str is less than len, then the remaining characters on the left are filled with character c

string2Bool

public static boolean string2Bool(String s)
Converts a string to boolean. String values 1 and true will result to true. Any other value will result to false.

Parameters:
s -
Returns:
returns a boolean value for the input string.

converts a boolean to 1 or 0

Parameters:
b -
Returns:
returns 1 or 0

removeLeadingZeros

public static String removeLeadingZeros(String s)
Removes leading zeros from a string. The method does not remove any leading spaces, so if the string starts with spaces, and then has leading zeros, they will not be removed.

Parameters:
s - String from which the method will remove any leading zeros.
Returns:
returns the string after it is striped from any leading zeros.

int2str

public static String int2str(int num,
                             int length)
Prints an integer to a string, adding leading zeroes so that the string has a specified length. If the length is less than the actual length of the input integer, then the output will be truncated.
Examples:
  • for integer 3 and length 4 returns 0003
  • for integer 3005 and length 3 returns 300 (truncates the digits from the right side).

    Parameters:
    num - integer that will be printed to string
    length - length of output string.
    Returns:
    Returns a string for the int, that has a fixed length.

    Parameters:
    length - length of new string
    c - character creating the new string.
    Returns:
    a String of defined length that contains only the character c

    addPrefix

    public static String addPrefix(String string,
                               String prefix)
    Adds a string to the left of an other string, only if none of the strings is null.

    Parameters:
    string - String on which a prefix is added.
    prefix - prefix to add to the string.
    Returns:
    Returns the string with the additional part on its left if both strings are not null, otherwise returns the initial string.

    Parameters:

    postfix - postfix to add to the string.
    Returns:

                              String surround)

    Parameters:

    surround - String that will surround the initial string.
    Returns:

    findParameters

    public static Set<String> findParameters(String string,
                                         String parameterPrefix)
    Finds the names of the parameters marked with a prefix in a string. This method helps the parsing of strings that have some parameters inside them. Parameters are words that start with the specified character. Colon as an example (:) is used as parameter marker for sql strings.

    Parameters:
    string - String parsed.
    parameterPrefix - String put to parameters as prefix.
    Returns:
    Returns a Set with the names of the parameters.

    findNextParameter

    public static Pair<String,String> findNextParameter(String string,
                                                    String parameterPrefix)
    Finds the first parameter in a string, that is marked with a prefix.

    Parameters:
    string - String in which the parameter is searched.
    parameterPrefix - Prefix that marks the parameter.
    Returns:
    Returns a pair that contains the name of the first parameter on the left and the remainder of the string on the right. If the string ends with this parameter, or there is no parameter in the string then, then the right element of the pair is null.

    replaceIgnoringCase

    public static String replaceIgnoringCase(String s,
                                         String subString,
                                         String replacement)
    Replaces a specified char sequence (CS) in a given String (GS) with a given replacement String (RS). The case of the input GS and the input CS is ignored when matching the CS to the GS.

    Parameters:
    s - Given string.
    subString - subString to match on s.
    replacement - replacement string
    Returns:
    s where subString is replaced with replacement.

    uScore2camelCase

    public static String uScore2camelCase(String string)
    Converts a string that has words separated with underscore to a camel case string.
    Example: invoice_no -> invoiceNo.

    Parameters:
    string - String to convert.
    Returns:
    Returns the converted string.

    truncateToLength

    public static String truncateToLength(String string,
                                      int length)
    Truncates the specified string if necessary to the specified maximum length.

    Parameters:
    string -
    length -
    Returns:
    If the string is null, returns an empty string. If the string has a length that excceeds the specified maximum length, then it is truncated to the specified maximum length.

    Returns:
